result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Sorensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug;  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Sex offender treatment.    Psychiatric/psychological.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with PAC (DOB 6/19/96), Alawna D and their employment or residence, Keith S, any minors without agents permission.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms. Sex Offender Registration & comply with terms of reports. Criminal thinking treatment.

records.addlTxt: Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 11 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Court reinstates bond; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

114pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Daniel Tombasco  appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: RMM  Referred to Br.6 for Sentencing on 12/16/15 @ 230pm.  No Bond - Deft to remain in custody.  Return to Br.6.  kmk
DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty D Celebre appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Atty Celebre states the deft came with him to the courthouse, unknown where he is now.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant with no bond.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 12/11/15 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Celebre states he is new to the case, would like a DA PTC.  DA PTC 9/18/15 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/6/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
Atty David Celebre

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states she was advised that within the next week a new public defender should be appointed.  STC continued to 9/16/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft states he is not satisfied w/Atty Lassiter's representation.  Court allows Atty Lassiter to withdraw.  STC 8/25/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victims mother appeared.  ADA Delgado states she held off on filing joinder motion to see if deft is going to accept the global offer.  Atty Lassiter states she is unsure how deft wants to proceed.  STC set for 8/4/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record the MH is continued to 7/13/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
